page.title: 18SHOPS IN BRODICK
page.content: The shops in Brodick attract many customers from other parts of the island.This is due firstly to their number and secondly the variety of goods sold. All supplies are transported to the island by ferry from the mainland if the product cannot be made on the island. Consequently prices are higher here. Within our area of study are the Arran Craft Shop, an antique shop and four food shops. Wooley's, the bakery, sells its own bread and cakes but wrapped bread from the firms on the mainland arrive on the first sailing each day as do the newspapers for Curries, a general store and food shop Coopers Finefare and the Co-op each have a branch in Brodick though these supermarkets are much smaller than those on the mainland.Chemist,medicine Hot Bread Shop,health food and tearoom
